intro: [WRONG START] Ophrys × filemenoi, commonly known as the Filomena orchid, is a hybrid orchid species that exhibits a complex mix of traits from its parent species. It is characterized by its striking, bee-mimicking flowers that play a crucial role in its pollination strategy. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is found in the Mediterranean region. Its inflorescence consists of numerous showy, hooded flowers that are specialized for attracting pollinators. Botanically, it is noted for its intricate floral structures and its role in the study of hybridization in orchids.
